column3:
time interval between incoming data from 
WPS, which is the interval (secs) between 
times in the lateral boundary condition file;  
em_real only
whether to use input files for nest domains

option to select fields to use from nest 
input for initialization;

= 0 : all fields are used

= 2 : only input specified from input
stream 2 (defined in Registry) are 
used for nests; must set io_form_auxinput2

Frequency (in simulation minutes) that 
data are written/recorded to history output 
file(s) (wrfout_d0); can also use 
history_interval_d, history_interval_h, 
history_interval_m, history_interval_s, 
alternatively to set the frequency in days,
hours, mins, secs, respectfully

Number of mins from the start of the run
in which the history output file (wrfout)
is written; can also use history_begin_d, 
history_begin_h, history_begin_m, 
history_begin_s alternatively to set the 
frequency in days, hours, mins, secs, 
respectfully

number of history output times bulked into 
each history file; used to split output files 
into smaller pieces
whether this run is a restart simulation
restart output file interval in minutes

.false. : uses all output intervals (including
history) given by the wrfrst file;

.true. : uses restart output intervals
given by namelist

.false. = no history file written at restart
initial time (prevents overwriting original
history file at this time); 

.true. = history file written at the intial
time of the restart

tells the model to write out an empty file
with the name "wrfoutReady_d<domain>;" 
useful in production runs so post-processing
code can check on run completeness, 
using this file

whether to overwrite the simulation start
date with the forecast start time

name of input file from WPS; only
necessary if not using the default file names

name of input file for lower boundary file;
created by real.exe when sst_update=1

interval in mins for lower boundary file; 
only used when sst_update=1

I/O format for wrflowinp files; only used
when sst_update=1 (2 = netCDF)

I/O format of history output file(s);

=2 : netCDF

=102 : split netCDF files, one per processor; 
must restart with same number of processors

= 1 : binary format; note: no supported
post-processing software available

= 4 : PHDF5; note: no supported post-
processing software available

= 5 : GRIB1

= 10 : GRIB2

= 11 : parallel netCDF

I/O format of input (met_em) files;

=2 : netCDF

=102 : split netCDF files, allows real.exe to
read-in split met_em files, and write split 
wrfinput files.

I/O format of the wrfbdy file;

=2 : netCDF

= 4 : PHDF5; note: no supported 
post-processing software available

= 5 : GRIB1

= 10 : GRIB2

= 11 : parallel netCDF

IO format for input stream 2 data;

=2 : netCDF

=4 : PHD5

=5 : GRIB1

=10 : GRIB2

=11 : pnetCDF

option to print out time series of model
diagnostics;

=0 : no print

=1 : domain-averaged 3-hourly
hydrostatic surface pressure tendency 
(Dpsfc/Dt), and dry-hydrostatic column 
pressure tendency (Dmu/Dt) added to 
standard output file

=2 : option 1, plus domain-averaged
rainfall, sfc evaporation, and sensible 
and latent heat fluxes

giving this a larger value (50, 200, etc.) 
increases debugging print-outs when 
running; 

NOTE: removed from default 
namelists - rarely provides useful info
and adds extra junk to standard 
error/output files, making them difficult 
to read and sometimes too large to write 
â€“ causing runtime crashes.

file name for extra output when using
auxhist2. Only the first part can be 
changed (e.g., "rainfall_d<domain>_<date>")

interval (in mins) for output when using 
auxhist2

output file format when using auxhist2;

=2 : netCDF

=4 : PHD5

=5 : GRIB1

=10 : GRIB2

=11 : pnetCDF

how many history output times are in
each auxhist2 output file

interval (mins) for obs nudging input; 
should be set at the same (or greater) 
frequency as 'obs_ionf' (with the unit of
coarse domain time step)

end of the observation time (in hrs) when
using obs nudging

set to .true. to replace colons with
underscores in output file names

set to .true. to output a 'wrfinput' file for
all time periods
adjust output times to the nearest hour

set to =1 to add 48 sfc diagnostic arrays
(max/min/mean/std) in the specified
time interval

set to =1 to add 'history_interval' 
diagnostic fileds (10m wind sp, 2-5 km 
max helicity, max vert. velocity in updraft
and downdraft below 400mb, 2-5 km mean 
vert. velocity, max column graupel;
must also turn on 'do_radar_ref'
